column4: can someone please offer me some advice? i bought a new wireless router to upgrade from G to N but my ubuntu computer wireless only went from 54 MB/s to 65 MB/s ... not the performance increase i was expecting .... i've googled this problem and am exhausted ... what settings/software updates can i try to improve my MB/s rating?
is your card an N card?
Atheros AR9285 802.11b/g/n
does your router have the 100MBs burts setting?
it's a linksys E2000
i'm not sure, let me see
look at doc
it has a frame burst radio button with enabled/disabled ... the value is set to enabled
I have a testing solution for you
I can't believe I am going to suggest this but create a Virtual Machine with Windows XP
test there
ty ... btw i am on a windows computer right now
XP?
yes
do you have an alternate card?
wait a min, your on windows and asking in a Linux forum? LoL
the ubuntu is a close nettop box i use for my entertainment center pc ... i have alternbate wireless USB sticks ... but they are all wireless G
install virtual ubuntu into VMware
i am on my windows computer because it's hard to read/type on the entertainment center computer (ubuntu)
thats what SSH is for and text based IRC clients LoL
i can putty into the computer
are there any solutins?
this did happen to me once, I got a new card and that fixed it
did you read this http://www.hitxp.com/articles/software/ubuntu-fix-slow-wireless-internet-connection-speed-upgrading-11-04-natty-narwhal/
